title: Is crit realy core on ad carries?
body:

replies.body: The thing about adding not-crit AD items to the games is that they'll make top laners (champions with very high AD ratios) stronger. Crit is what lets marksman be worth bringing, because otherwise they'd just do less damage and be more squishy. Kalista is just a unique case because of her execute.

And even on Kalista, you should evaluate your build choices based on the enemy team.

Runaan's is pretty decent on her, yes, but only against squishy and/or very kiteable teams. If the enemy team has a lot of tanky characters to kill, you're better off with a more traditional, crit-based build on her.

Best example:
Wildturtle's Kalista in the recent SKT vs TSM game, in which he could not do anything against Urgot/Gnar/Rek'Sai/Alistar.

A lot of people are talking about adc's and their waveclears as necessity. Someone mentioned it's the mid role to waveclear. I notice that in a lot of my games (through silver and gold) the adc is always trying to last hit during that "dance" before a team fight or a skirmish, and the losses usually occur because they get focussed by engagers, like Vi or Malphite. 

From my experience, low elo adc's want that waveclear more, but more to cs steal from mid during the mid game or if they come mid to gank early. I'm not saying wave clear is bad, but it's not the goal of the adc, I agree that mid (or mage supports and other champs) should wave clear, or have tanks at the front while the adc safely farms as you slow push forward. Having the adc trying to waveclear is why they're usually out of position. I'd rather have my Vel or Lux waveclear from the back, than have the adc at the front trying to do it, trading 200 gold in minions for a 1000 gold in a lost team fight

Same goes for turret pushing. I've often been mid or supp mages, sieging a turret. While I can clear the minions and even hit the enemy from outside turret range, my adc is trying to do that instead. So instead of dealing turret damage (more so mid - late game, and i find it most annoying if it's an objective losing game and we REALLY need those turrets) the adc is trying to farm still, and by the time they do, the enemy has respawned or whatever. I often end up attacking turrets myself, and have even seen fights lost, because while it takes me 3 seconds to kill the turret, the adc could do it in 1.5 but would rather chase and dive. We have two guys die to turret damage, and 2 more trying to escape turret damage, when only one more hit would have killed it. I just don't understand those situations, adc's should focus objectives, plain and simple

BC has only half the straight AD of BT, but the stacking armor shred (on multiple targets because of Hurricane) seems really good too. Personally I think it'd be easier to remove life steal from ADC items (or weaken it) then remove Crit. While I think Crit should go completely, or be changed to improve dps rather than the burst feature feature it is (if crits did "some" bonus damage, but focussed on armour shredding - tanks would still melt to ADC's but they wouldn't be able to burst other classes) 

With life steal (+ crits) many adc will burst, sustain damage and heal at the same time. Many adc can recover from being out of position or caught out because they can land some slow, use a dash or in some cases root or stun, shoot three minions or hide in jungle and come out with full hp. If adc didn't steal so much life, they'd be forced to focus entirely on good positioning and sustaining damage from a safe distance. An adc the messes up can be saved it they are not 100-0 by any other cc champ. I know some ADC's focus on AD caster or pure burst (some graves, not all) but most go with Life steal and crit builds for sustain, dps, burst and objective control all at once. 

side note:
Thematically speaking, a ranged carry should have less damage then a melee one. The difference is meant to be the "safety" and "speed", individual hits SHOULD be higher on melee champs, but crit is focussed on ranged champs, but they also keep their other advantages of safety and AS. 
The only other edit (while I think it makes sense for ranged carries to have cc) would be to remove mobility. It's the one thing a ranged champ shouldn't and wouldn't have. Moving goes against AS, from a literal stand point, it weakens accuracy (and therefore damage and especially crit chance) and physically a ranged champ would lack burst movement anyway. Usually they have a higher base movement speed due to light equipment, but low burst movement due to weaker bodies and awkward equipment. League doesn't follow those laws, and pack out too many overlapping advantages on a single champion type. The ONLY thing they don't do in league is Tank, but with a late game build they can even do that sometimes (without hard cc to stop them)

Crit is the difference between doing 300 damage per attack and doing 750 every other attack. So when it comes to late game, crit is the defining stat on ADC. That said, mid game power spiking ADC use to be a thing. Champs like Graves and Sivir would get Bloodthirster (back when it gave 100 AD) and Corki and Ezreal would get Triforce and those champions would spike really hard mid game. But after Riot normalized the max AD you could get from a single item to 80, it just became more efficient to build an IE for mid game and late game power. You can try doing a no crit build to try and sneak more utility into your build but often it's not really worth it because you have allies for utility and your mid game power spike wont be much greater than it would be if you went a crit build.

Kalista also happens to be a special case because of how her rend mechanic works. She can stack up a lot of damage that can make up for her lack of crit.

Lifesteal builds favor sustained battles while crit builds favor shorter battles. 

Non crit builds generally favor heavy lifesteal.  They're good for ADCs who naturally have a lot of sustained damage in their kit.  You're a lot more likely to see Vayne and Kalista running BT + BotRK in lieu of IE for this reason. With Vayne's true damage and Kalista's infinitely stacking rend, you don't *need* crit to deal ADC amounts of damage.

However, even still, both of these ADCs still benefit heavily from crit if you choose to build it.  It really just comes down to user preference in their case.  

Other ADCs unfortunately don't have this luxury, so for the most part it's core because they need the extra damage to be relevant.
